Bases: object

blur_psf(psf_blurring=None)ÔÉÅ

blur the PSF

calc_psf_sigma()ÔÉÅ

estimate Gaussian sigma-equivalent size of the PSF

determine_psf_blurring()ÔÉÅ

determine the best PSF blurring value based on the number of stars detected

fit_sky(fit_to='residual_masked', poly_deg=1, radius_in=7, width=7, plot=False, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ
fix_psf()ÔÉÅ

make sure the sum of PSF is 1

init_size_guess(sigma_guess=10, center_slack=0.2, plot=False, sigma_kernel=5, clip_lower_counts_percentile=10, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

roughly estimate the effective radius using Gaussian profile. :param sigma_guess: initial guess for the standard deviation of the Gaussian profile (in pixels) :type sigma_guess: float :param center_slack: the fraction of the image size (from center) within which the center of the galaxy is expected. Default is 5% :type center_slack: float

Returns:

rough estimate of the effective radius (in pixels)

Return type:

float

crop_in(x0, y0, size)ÔÉÅ

crop-in and re-generate the MultiBandCutout object :param multiband_obj: the object to crop in :type multiband_obj: MultiBandCutout :param x0: the center of the new image :type x0: float :param y0: the center of the new image :type y0: float :param size: the size of the new image (in pixels) :type size: int

Returns:

the cropped object

Return type:
